Is there any way to "catch" a compile error for failure assertion?

I have =
classes whose methods accept specific combinations of generic
parameter typ=
es, and I want to test to make sure that the bad
combinations truly generat=
e compile errors.  I have not been able to
figure out an automatic way to t=
est for a compile error as part of my
JUnit test suite.  Currently, I have =
to manually uncomment the bad
code lines to "test" if they are still bad co=
mpiles.  Is there a
better way?
